title: 113_s2436
content: The "Empower Employees Act of 2014" prohibits the deduction of labor organization dues from employee pay. The "Empower Employees Act of 2014" prohibits agencies from deducting labor organization dues from employee pay. This includes a restriction on using appropriated funds for such deductions. The definition of "agency" includes Executive agencies, the legislative branch, the judicial branch, and the government of the District of Columbia. The "Empower Employees Act of 2014" prohibits agencies from deducting labor organization dues from employee pay, including a restriction on using appropriated funds for such deductions. The definition of "agency" encompasses Executive agencies, the legislative branch, the judicial branch, and the government of the District of Columbia. The table of sections for chapter 71 of title 5, United States Code, is amended accordingly. The "Empower Employees Act of 2014" prohibits agencies from deducting labor organization dues from employee pay. Section 1205 of title 39, United States Code, is repealed, and the table of sections for chapter 12 is amended. Effective dates and transition provisions are outlined in Section 3. The amendments made by the "Empower Employees Act of 2014" take effect on the date of enactment. Transition provisions ensure that current deductions for dues of an exclusive representative are not terminated before the assignment is revoked or a specified date under section 7115 of title 5, United States Code. The Act ensures that current deductions for dues of labor organizations are not terminated before the underlying agreement ceases to have effect. The Act prevents the early termination of dues deductions for labor organizations before the agreement expires. It also states that agreements related to dues deductions cannot be renewed or extended. The Act prohibits the early termination of dues deductions for labor organizations and states that agreements related to dues deductions cannot be renewed or extended. Definitions for key terms are provided in section 7103 of title 5, United States Code.
